_header: I vow to God she makes great steer
Subjects: Black Agnes of Dunbar; historical poems; chronicles, verse in
_description: A song of the English against Black Agnes of Dunbar, quoted in Wyntoun’s Chronicle (658) — two couplets (VIII. 4993)

BLCottNeroDXI.Transcription: I wow to god scho mais gret stereþe scottis wenche ploddeyrCum I are or cum I latI fande Annete at þe ȝhat
BLCottNeroDXI.Note: Two couplets at end of Book 8, chapter 29 line 4993 in Wyntoun’s  Chronicle.

NLS1923.Transcription:
I wow to god scho makis gret stereþe scottis wench
                    ploddereCum I aire or cum I laitI fand Annes at þe
                    ȝate
NLS1923.Note: At end of Book VIII, chapter 29.

NLS1924.Transcription:
I wow to god scho beris hir weillThe scottis wenche with hir
                    plodtillffor cum I air cum I laitI fand Dayme annes at þe
                    ȝait

EDULaiii431.Transcription:
I wow to god scho makis gret stereþe scottis wench
                    ploddereCum I aire or cum I laitI fand Annes at þe
                    ȝate
EDULaiii431.Note: At end of Book VIII, chapter 29.

NLS651.Transcription:
I wow to god scho beris hire weleThe scottis wenche with hire
                    plodilleffor cum I ayrly cum I layteI fynd Dame Annes at the
                    ȝhate
NLS651.Note: At end of Chapter CLXVIII (viiixx viii).

StADA775.Transcription:
I wow to god scho mais gret stereÞe Scotts wenche
                    ploddereCum I ayre cum I latI fynd annot at þe gat
StADA775.Note: At end of Book VIII, ch. 29.

Weymyss.Transcription:
I wowe to god scho mais gret stereThe Scottis wenche ploddeyrCum
                    I are cum I latI fande Annote at þe ȝhat
